learning_objective: Create programs that include sequences, events, loops, and conditionals.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is working on a program that processes the financial transactions of a small business. They want to develop a code snippet that calculates the total inventory cost, given the number of items and their costs. The code also applies a discount if the total cost exceeds a certain value. What will the function totalCost(3,10) return when the threshold value is set to 25 and the discount is 10%?",
    "Answer1": "30",
    "Answer2": "27",
    "Answer3": "10",
    "Answer4": "3",
    "CorrectAnswer": "2",
    "Explanation": "The function totalCost(3,10) calculates the total cost of the items by multiplying the number of items by the cost per item (3*10=30). Since this cost exceeds the threshold value of 25, it applies a discount of 10%. This discount calculates as 30-30*0.1=27, so the function returns 27.",
    "code_snippet": "integer totalCost(integer items, integer cost)\n    integer threshold = 25\n    integer total = items * cost\n    if total > threshold\n        total = total - total * 0.1\n    end\n    return total\nend"
}
